base_config.description: Base configuration name, e.g. nam3, based on which this configuration is created. Only set for user managed configurations. baseConfig must refer to a configuration of type GOOGLE_MANAGED in the same project as this configuration.

config_type.description: Output only. Whether this instance config is a Google or User Managed Configuration.

display_name.description: The name of this instance configuration as it appears in UIs.

effective_labels.description: All of labels (key/value pairs) present on the resource in GCP, including the labels configured through Terraform, other clients and services.

labels.description: An object containing a list of "key": value pairs. Example: { "name": "wrench", "mass": "1.3kg", "count": "3" }. **Note**: This field is non-authoritative, and will only manage the labels present in your configuration. Please refer to the field 'effective_labels' for all of the labels present on the resource.

name.description: A unique identifier for the instance configuration. Values are of the form projects/<project>/instanceConfigs/[a-z][-a-z0-9]*

terraform_labels.description: The combination of labels configured directly on the resource and default labels configured on the provider.

default_leader_location.description: If true, this location is designated as the default leader location where leader replicas are placed.

location.description: The location of the serving resources, e.g. "us-central1".

type.description: Indicates the type of replica.  See the [replica types documentation](https://cloud.google.com/spanner/docs/replication#replica_types) for more details. Possible values: ["READ_WRITE", "READ_ONLY", "WITNESS"]

block.description: The geographic placement of nodes in this instance configuration and their replication properties.
